item.title: Neuralink 联合创始人的新创公司销售大脑计算机工具包
item.description:
马克斯-霍达克（Max Hodak）的公司 "科学"（Science）正在销售能让研究人员更轻松地探究大脑的设备和软件。【原文：

Max Hodak’s company, Science, is selling devices and software that make it easier for researchers to probe the mind.

】

item.title: 据说 KKR 支持的 Vantage 正在考虑出售西班牙的电信塔
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由 KKR & Co.支持的电信塔所有者和运营商 Vantage Towers AG 正在考虑出售其在西班牙的资产。【原文：Vantage Towers AG, an owner and operator of telecom towers backed by KKR & Co., is considering a sale of its assets in Spain, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织认为干旱将赞比亚经济增长降至 25 年最低点
item.description: 除了在 2020 年疫情最严重的时候出现萎缩之外，赞比亚的经济扩张幅度可能是 1998 年以来最小的，原因是国际货币基金组织警告说，创纪录的干旱将阻碍经济增长，其影响比预期的要严重得多。【原文：Zambia’s economy will probably expand by the smallest amount since 1998 — besides a contraction during the height of the pandemic in 2020 — because of a worse-than-anticipated impact from a record drought that the International Monetary Fund warned will stunt growth.】

item.title: Adobe 支付现金以消除创作者对人工智能的担忧
item.description: Adobe 认为它已经找到了治疗人工智能工作焦虑症的方法：现金。但首先...【原文：Adobe thinks it has found a cure for AI job anxiety: cash. But first...】

item.title: 萨姆-奥特曼的能源 "新政 "对人工智能有利。美国人呢？
item.description:
OpenAI的创始人要求华盛顿在新发电厂上花费数千亿美元。社会也需要看到其中的益处。【原文：

OpenAI’s founder is asking Washington to spend hundreds of billions of dollars on new power plants. Society needs to see the benefit, too.

】

item.title: 美国大选让气候科技投资者进入观望模式
item.description:
由于融资方和创始人都在面对特朗普第二次当选总统的前景及其对减碳技术的影响，因此资本市场停滞不前。【原文：

Capital has stalled as financers and founders confront the prospect of a second Trump presidency and its impact on carbon-cutting technologies.

】

item.title: 库什-塔德的 7-Eleven 连锁店将面临美国联邦贸易委员会的怀疑性审查
item.description: 据彭博新闻社分析，Circle K 运营商 Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. 如果继续以 472 亿美元收购竞争对手 7-Eleven 所有者 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：Circle K operator Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. is likely to face a tough US antitrust review if it moves forward with its $47.2 billion bid to buy rival 7-Eleven owner Seven & i Holdings Co., according to a Bloomberg News analysis.】

item.title: Blackstone 的信贷部门现已成为其最重要的业务部门，为其利润推波助澜
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 第三季度利润增长，原因是其信贷部门受到投资者现金流入的推动，成为其资产规模最大的业务。【原文：Blackstone Inc. posted an increase in third-quarter profit as its credit arm was boosted by an influx of investor cash and became its biggest business by assets.】

item.title: 电信市场困难重重，诺基亚在华裁员近 2000 人
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，芬兰诺基亚公司将在中国裁员近2000人，作为该公司应对电信设备市场疲软的全面成本削减计划的一部分。【原文：Nokia Oyj is to cut almost 2,000 jobs in China, as part of a sweeping cost-reduction program as the Finnish company grapples with a sluggish telecom equipment market, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 越南表示愿意下调主要利率以促进增长
item.description: 在超强台风 "八木 "造成破坏后，越南国家银行愿意继续下调政策利率以支持经济增长。【原文：The State Bank of Vietnam is open to continue cutting policy rates to support growth following the destruction caused by Super Typhoon Yagi.】

item.title: 萨南公司首席执行官称欧洲天然气仍易受干扰影响
item.description: 俄罗斯与欧洲的天然气过境协议可能终止，这对意大利的影响 "微乎其微"。不过，Snam SpA 公司首席执行官斯特凡诺-维尼耶（Stefano Venier）表示，由于欧洲大陆对进口货物的依赖性增加，意大利仍然很脆弱。【原文：The possible end of the Russian gas transit agreement to Europe will have a “very negligible” impact on Italy. Still, the continent remains vulnerable with its increased reliance on imported cargoes, according to Snam SpA Chief Executive Officer Stefano Venier.】

item.title: 美国银行在菲律宾开展外汇业务
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）周四启动了在菲律宾的外汇业务，希望在亚洲增长最快的经济体之一菲律宾开拓外国投资者、外包公司和芯片制造商的市场。【原文：Bank of America Corp. on Thursday kicked off its foreign exchange business in the Philippines, looking to tap foreign investors, outsourcing companies and chip manufacturers in one of Asia’s fastest-growing economies.】

item.title: 黄金破纪录反弹暗示通胀担忧：市场日报
item.description: 市场发出了一个明确的信号，即对抗美国通胀的战争尚未结束。【原文：Markets are sending a clear signal that the war against US inflation isn’t over yet.】

item.title: 因看好 IT 开支复苏，Infosys 上调销售额预期
item.description: Infosys Ltd.今年第二次上调了年度销售额预期，表明由于主要经济体的恢复性增长和通胀放缓，客户再次愿意在软件服务上消费。【原文：Infosys Ltd. raised its annual sales forecast for the second time this year, suggesting clients are again willing to spend on software services thanks to resilient growth and slowing inflation in major economies.】

item.title: Elevance 因预测下调和第三季度盈利不佳而暴跌
item.description: Elevance Health Inc. 早盘股价下挫，此前该保险公司下调了今年的业绩展望，并报告称第三季度利润低于华尔街预期，理由是医疗补助支付不足。【原文：Elevance Health Inc. shares sank in early trading after the insurer cut its outlook for the year and reported third-quarter profit below Wall Street expectations, citing insufficient payments from Medicaid.】

item.title: 瑞典将修改预算规则以增加政府支出
item.description: 瑞典将放弃预算盈余的目标，允许在国防和修复破败的基础设施方面增加支出。【原文：Sweden will move away from a budget-surplus target to allow larger spending on defense and restoring decrepit infrastructure.】

item.title: 尼日利亚油轮大爆炸死亡人数增至 153 人
item.description: 尼日利亚警方称，该国北部一辆汽油罐车爆炸造成的死亡人数现已增至 153 人。【原文：Nigerian police said the death toll from an explosion involving a gasoline tanker in the country’s north has now increased to 153.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚与中国 CATL 成立价值 12 亿美元的电池合资企业
item.description: 印度尼西亚宣布与中国当代安培科技有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.Ltd.合资，投资12亿美元在印尼生产电池，这是印尼成为全球电动汽车中心的最新举措。【原文：Indonesia announced a joint venture with China’s Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. to invest $1.2 billion in battery production in the country, the latest boost to its ambitions of becoming a global hub for electric vehicles.】

item.title: 马斯克的帝国面临被欧盟针对潜在 X 罚款的风险
item.description: 欧盟已警告 X，在计算对该社交媒体平台的罚款时，可能会将埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）其他业务（包括太空探索技术公司（Space Exploration Technologies Corp）和神经链路公司（Neuralink Corp））的收入计算在内。【原文：The European Union has warned X that it may calculate fines against the social-media platform by including revenue from Elon Musk’s other businesses, including Space Exploration Technologies Corp. and Neuralink Corp., an approach that would significantly increase the potential penalties for violating content moderation rules.】

item.title: 中国对冲基金半夏称现在是购买股票的好时机
item.description: 一家知名的中国宏观对冲基金建议散户投资者现在买入股票，并称相对较低的估值和政府的政策支持是市场的利好因素。【原文：A renowned Chinese macro hedge fund advised retail investors to buy stocks now, citing relatively low valuations and the government’s policy support as tailwinds for the market.】

item.title: 捷克央行行长重申谨慎降息的誓言
item.description: 捷克央行行长 Ales Michl 重申，他承诺将 "非常谨慎地 "采取宽松货币政策，以避免引发通胀回升。【原文：Czech central bank Governor Ales Michl reiterated his pledge to move “very cautiously” with monetary easing to avoid provoking a resurgence in inflation.】

item.title: 奢华日本温泉品牌将在纽约开设美国首家分店
item.description: 星野度假村（Hoshino Resorts）是一家拥有 110 年历史的公司，以在日本经营豪华温泉酒店而闻名。【原文：Hoshino Resorts, a 110-year-old company famed for its luxury hot springs hotels in Japan, will open its first resort location in the continental US in a small New York town.】

item.title: Netflix涨幅达 340%，销售额增长已过巅峰，前景黯淡
item.description: 在经历了价值增长超过 2300 亿美元的突破性反弹后，华尔街表示 Netflix 公司的顶峰可能已经到来。【原文：After a breakneck rally that added more than $230 billion in value, Wall Street is indicating that peak Netflix Inc. may have arrived.】

item.title: 欧元区 9 月通胀率下调，支持欧洲央行降息
item.description: 欧元区通胀放缓的程度超过了最初的报告，这为欧洲中央银行连续第二次降息提供了依据。【原文：Euro-area inflation slowed more than initially reported – cementing the case for a second straight interest-rate cut by the European Central Bank.】

item.title: 当投资者需要预测时，美联储却停留在六周的数据周期上
item.description: 在过去的几个月里，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔一直在强调一个观点，即利率决策将根据新的数据逐次会议作出。【原文：For the past several months, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has hammered home the idea that interest-rate decisions will be made meeting by meeting based on incoming data.】

item.title: 泰国意外降息预示未来政策之争
item.description: 即使在货币政策制定者软化了对降息的抵制之后，泰国央行和政府之间的冲突仍在继续。【原文：Thailand’s central bank and government remain on a collision course even after monetary policymakers softened their resistance to rate cuts.】

item.title: Couche-Tard 公司高管提出收购东京 Seven & i 公司的理由
item.description: Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.的创始人和高管们本周将在东京逗留三天，试图以约 7.1 万亿日元（474 亿美元）的价格收购 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.’s founder and top executives are spending three days in Tokyo this week, seeking to make their case for buying Seven & i Holdings Co. for about ¥7.1 trillion ($47.4 billion) despite being rebuffed by the Japanese retailer.】

item.title: 南非考虑通过补贴和返利促进电动汽车产业发展
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）表示，南非正在考虑出台激励措施，鼓励本地生产电动汽车，并提供退税或补贴，以促进电动汽车的使用。【原文：South Africa is considering introducing incentives to encourage local manufacturing of electric vehicles and offering tax rebates or subsidies to promote their usage, President Cyril Ramaphosa said.】

item.title: 西门子官员称德国经济困境阻碍投资
item.description: 西门子公司的一位官员表示，德国经济的萎靡不振阻碍了投资。【原文：Germany’s economic malaise is a deterrent for investment, according to a Siemens AG official.】

item.title: 比金丝雀码头还大的沙特金融中心寻求 7 亿美元投资
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的主要金融区--规模几乎是伦敦金丝雀码头的三倍--正寻求从股权投资者那里筹集约 7 亿美元，为利雅得房地产综合体的进一步开发提供资金。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s main finance district — almost three times the size of London’s Canary Wharf — is looking to raise about $700 million from equity investors to fund further development of its Riyadh real estate complex.】
